alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Alachua, southwestern Union and south central Columbia Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 728 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort White, or 9 miles southeast of Ichetucknee Spring, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort White, Upland Pines and Providence. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Alachua; Southern Columbia; Union; Western Alachua
